definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: After winning the lottery jackpot, he went from rags to riches overnight.
sentences.chinese: 赢了乐透头彩后，他一夕之间从一贫如洗变成富翁。

sentences.english: Her family was impoverished by a fire.
sentences.chinese: 她的家庭被一场梆弄得一贫如洗。

sentences.english: Saibya was penniless and wept bitterly at her unending misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 赛伯亚一贫如洗，为自己无休止的不幸而悲痛地哭泣。

sentences.english: When Mr Smith died his wife and childern were left destitute .
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生死后他的妻儿变得一贫如洗。

sentences.english: Many sailors drink their wives and children out of doors.
sentences.chinese: 溺于酒以致妻儿一贫如洗。

sentences.english: Even the dogs lead a better life than him.
sentences.chinese: 他真的一贫如洗，生活潦倒得连狗都不如。

sentences.english: After making a fortune in business, he finished up poor at his death.
sentences.chinese: 他做生意发过大财，但临终时他一贫如洗。

sentences.english: Her exceptional musical talent took he from rags to riches.
sentences.chinese: 她杰出的音乐才能使她从一贫如洗到家财万贯。

sentences.english: In those years the landless peasants were brought to beggary.
sentences.chinese: 在那些年月里无地的农民一贫如洗。

definition: lit. with only four bare walls for a home (idiom)/fig. very poor/wretched
extreme poverty (idiom); destitute/penniless/poor as church mice
lit. build a high desk of debt (idiom); heavily in debt
hard pressed for money/in financial straits
without two nickels to rub together (idiom)/impoverished
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
without a penny to one's name/penniless/stony-broke
